context.description: This command opens the VA Java VCE on the selected Java class.
This command opens the VA Java BeanInfo Editor on the selected Java class.
This command computes the enabled metrics for the selected program elements.
This command removes the currently visible metric result set.
This command removes all of the metric result sets.
This command changes which metric result set is being viewed.
This command opens the Memory Monitor view.
This filter causes the task list to only show the tasks associated with a specific resource and its children.
This filter causes the task list to only show Java-related problems.
This filter causes the task list to only show errors and hide warnings and info messages.
This dialog helps you add a parameter to a method.
This dialog helps you add an exception to a method.
This editor allows you to edit a team task.
On this page, you can view the product version number and build date.
On this page, you can see the names of all of the people involved in building CodePro.
On this page, you can you can specify which audit tests are to be run.
This page allows you to control the code coverage engine.
This page allows you to control where the code coverage engine looks for coverage files.
This page allows you to control the connection between the workbench and the server.
This page allows you to control whether information about events in your workbench are broadcast to other users.
This page allows you to control how messages are handled.
This page allows you to control how team tasks are displayed and edited.
On this page, you can view either the CodePro log or the Eclipse log.
On this page, you can you can specify the colors used in the dependency view.
On this page, you can configure various formatting options.
On this page, you can configure various history and modified element tracking options.
On this page, you can you can specify formatting and visibility options for the Javadoc Repair tool.
This page allows you to control the functionality of the test code generator.
This page allows you to control whether test cases are automatically updated after editing the target class.
This page allows you to control the handling of Design by Contract tags.
This page allows you to control the usage of factory classes.
This page allows you to control the generation of test suites that can be used to run your test cases.
This page allows you to control the generation of mock objects.
This page allows you to control the execution of code under test when generating JUnit tests.
This page allows you to control the location of where tests are generated.
This page allows you to choose for which types and members tests will be generated.
This page allows you to control which methods are generated and to control the characteristics of generated tests.
This page allows you to control how test fixtures are generated.
This page allows you to control what comments are generated for test cases and tests.
This page allows you to enable generation of Spring unit tests.
On this page, you can you can specify the update frequency and colors of the memory monitor.
On this page, you can you can specify which metrics are to be computed.
On this page, you can you can specify various code generation options for patterns.
On this page, you can configure various startup options.
On this page, you can configure various Team and CVS options
On this page, you can define macros and keyword completions.
On this page, you can configure various VA Assist communications options.
This view provides a facility for scheduling various tasks to occur at startup, shutdown or scheduled times.
This view tracks all modifications or additions made to various types within the workspace.
This view tracks all modifications or additions made to various types within the workspace.
This view tracks all types that have been accessed within the workspace.
This view displays the results of computing metrics for one or more target elements.
This view displays the results of running audit tests for one or more target elements.
This view displays the code coverage data that has been gathered.
This view displays the results of running a dependency analysis.
This view displays the groups that are defined on the server.
This view displays the Javadoc changes proposed by the Javadoc Repair tool.
This view displays the amount of memory used in the environment.
This view displays the messages stored on the server for the current user.
This view displays the shared tasks that are defined on the server.
This view allows you to manage the team tasks that have been defined.
This view displays an outline of a test case.
This view displays the results of test generation.
This view displays the users that are defined on the server.
On this page, you can schedule when the task will start and how often it will repeat.
On this page, you can give the task a name and a description.
On this page, you can schedule an Ant build to run at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule an Export Set to run at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule an external program to run at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule a Java program to run at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule a message to be displayed at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule the workspace to be refreshed at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule the exit of the workbench at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule a workbench action at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule a CVS catchup working set operation to run at a specific time.
On this page, you can schedule a CVS catchup and release working set operation to run at a specific time.
Wizard to assist in creating a new method.
Wizard to assist in creating a new field.
Wizard to assist in creating classes implementing various design patterns.
On this page, you can select the strategy for implementing the chosen pattern.
Provide an interface for creating families of related or dependent objects without specifying their concrete classes.
Convert the interface of a class into another interface clients expect. Adapter lets classes work together that couldn't otherwise because of incompatible interfaces.
Create an Java Applet subclassed from java.applet.Applet or javax.swing.JApplet
Create an Java Application subclassed from java.awt.Frame or javax.swing.JFrame
Decouple an abstraction from its implementation so that the two can vary independently.
Separate the construction of a complex object from its representation so that the same construction process can create different representations.

Avoid coupling the sender of a request to its receiver by giving more than one object a chance to handle the request. Chain the receiving objects and pass the request along the chain until an object handles it.
Encapsulate a request as an object, thereby letting you parameterize clients with different requests, queue or log requests, and support undoable operations.
Compose objects into tree structures to represent whole-part hierarchies. Composite lets clients treat individual objects and compositions of objects uniformly.
Separates a data resource's client interface from its data access mechanisms, and adapts a specific data resource's access API to a generic client interface.
Attach additional responsibilities to an object dynamically. Decorators provide a flexible alternative to subclassing for extending functionality.
Provide a unified interface to a set of interfaces in a subsystem. Facade defines a higher-level interface that makes the subsystem easier to use.
Define an interface for creating an object, but let subclasses decide which class to instantiate. Factory Method lets a class defer instantiation to subclasses.
Use sharing to support large numbers of fine-grained objects efficiently.
Provides a dispatching servlet that invokes commands provided as arguments, thus eliminating duplicate code and simplifying content retrieval and error handling mechanisms.
Create a class implementing one or more interfaces.
Given a language, define a representation for its grammar along with an interpreter that uses the representation to interpret sentences in the language.
Provide a way to access the elements of an aggregate object sequentially without exposing its underlying representation.
Create a JUnit test case.
Create a JUnit test suite.

Define an object that encapsulates how a set of objects interact. Mediator promotes loose coupling by keeping objects from referring to each other explicitly, and it lets you vary their interaction independently.
Without violating encapsulation, capture and externalize an object's internal state so that the object can be restored to this state later.
Define a one-to-many dependency between objects so that when one object changes state, all its dependents are notified and updated automatically.
Specify the kinds of objects to create using a prototypical instance, and create new objects by copying this prototype.

Provide a surrogate or placeholder for another object to control access to it. Options are provided to implement all interfaces of the subject class as well as all of the public methods of the subject class.

Centralizes distributed service object lookups, provides a centralized point of control, and may act as a cache that eliminates redundant lookups. It also encapsulates any vendor-specific features of the lookup process.
Encapsulates the complexity of interactions between the business objects participating in a workflow.
Creates an Servlet subclassed from javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.
Ensure a class only has one instance, and provide a global point of access to it.
Allow an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes. The object will appear to change its class.
Define a family of algorithms, encapsulate each one, and make them interchangeable. Strategy lets the algorithm vary independently from clients that use it.

Defines the skeleton of an algorithm in an operation, deferring some steps to subclasses. Template Method lets subclasses refine certain steps of an algorithm without changing the algorithm's structure.
Encapsulates business data returned by an enterprise bean in response to a client request.
Assembles Transfer Objects for retrieving data from various business objects and other objects that define the model or part of the model.

Create a class that approximates an equivalent Pascal enumeration or C enum. A specific enumeration will be represented by a class with specific instances corresponding to each element of the enumerations and public static final fields to access the instances.
Represent an operation to be performed on the elements of an object structure. Visitor lets you define a new operation without changing the classes of the elements on which it operates.
